oai_dc:dc.dc:title: High Sequestration, Low Emission, Food Secure Farming. Organic Agriculture - a Guide to Climate Change & Food Security
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jordan, Robert
Müller, Adrian
Oudes, Anne
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
"Organics" in general
Air and water emissions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: - affordable high sequestration practices based on local resources - enables continuous farmer-based adaptation to climate change - ideal for the improvement of the world’s 400 million smallholder farms - locally adapted, affordable and people centered - empowers local communities - established practices, systems and markets - experience, practices and expertise to share
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Jordan, Robert; Müller, Adrian and Oudes, Anne (2009) High Sequestration, Low Emission, Food Secure Farming. Organic Agriculture - a Guide to Climate Change & Food Security. IFOAM and IFOAM EU Group 2009, D-Bonn and BE-Bruxelles.
